body.p:
Arkan Decr 15th 1860
G. W. Johnson Esqr
Dear Sir

I wrote you some weeks since requesting you to remit me some mony to pay for your deadening. As I have received no response I take it for granted you did not receive it. I have send to Judge Breckenridge of St Louis a check on you for $100 which you will please pay as I have already at great inconvenience advanced for you I have had deadened of your land about 280 acres & stopped. So soon as I the land I will draw on your for the ballance. If you will remit me the Amt of your taxes I will take pleasur in payng them for you.
